intro: Caesia setifera, commonly known as the slender beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. Caesia setifera typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important component of its native ecosystems.
